intro: Bahiopsis subincisa, commonly known as the narrowleaf bahiopsis, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The flowers are small and yellow, appearing in clusters, and bloom during the warmer months of the year.
